key_responsibilities: assisting the Member in responding to constituent issues and problems with federal agencies
staying on top of everyday events in the Member’s district
keeping the community connected to the Member’s work
requirements: patience and skill in resolving constituent problems
ability to handle multiple tasks and issues effectively
ability to work independently and think outside the box
prior community or casework experience helpful
significant experience interacting with the public
working knowledge or strong interest in the District of Columbia and its local government
willingness to become a resident of the District of Columbia
salary: based on skill and experience level

office: Senior, Progressive, Democratic Ways and Means Committee Member
key_responsibilities: handling tax, pension, financial services, small business, immigration, and homeland security policy
requirements: ability to learn quickly, multi-task, and work independently

key_responsibilities: handling a broad portfolio focusing on domestic issues – health care, economic development, and immigration
requirements: strong written and oral communication skills
ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
poise, patience and a sense of humor

key_responsibilities: providing administrative support to the Member of Congress
coordinating and maintaining the Member’s calendar
coordinating meetings, travel, trainings and other events
monitoring deadlines and following up on tasks
coordinating mailings and distributions of information
preparing briefing materials and legislative updates
making telephone calls on the Member’s behalf
greeting constituents and coordinating with staff
requirements: BA/BS degree and 4 years of executive assistant experience; OR eight years of relevant work experience
excellent interpersonal and customer service skills

key_responsibilities: writing press releases, talking points, op-eds
requirements: ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks
experience with national and local media

key_responsibilities: developing, managing and coordinating all communications activities
writing press releases, op-eds, mail pieces, talking points
requirements: ability to manage multiple communications projects
ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment
depth of legislative and policy knowledge
ability to work extended hours and under time pressure

key_responsibilities: performing other related duties as assigned
requirements: thorough knowledge of the legislative process and House procedures
ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines

key_responsibilities: conducting investigations and proceedings regarding Members and staff
requirements: minimum of 5 years of experience with complex investigations
outstanding analytical and written and oral communication skills
experience in government ethics, criminal law, civil litigation, administrative investigations and adjudications, depositions, and familiarity with Congress

key_responsibilities: serving as the congressman’s liaison with the community
staffing and representing the congressman at events
advising the congressman about local issues
helping organize community meetings and events
preparing Member for speeches and meetings
supervising field team and district activities
requirements: strong written, communication, analytical, and organization skills
ability to relate well with diverse backgrounds
four years of experience working directly with the community
ability to work efficiently as a member of a team
salary: will depend on the experience of the applicant

representing the Member at meetings and events
editing constituent correspondence and written material

thorough knowledge of House rules and legislative process

overseeing compilation of daily news clips

staffing the member at public events
developing and implementing strategic communications plans
